channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Outside Fire; INC#0237; 06:26AM; 19337 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZK8rCn; Tarzana; Firefighters are applying heavy streams to a large, outside fire (Synthetic Grass Depot) which is not threatening any structures. Due to the depth of the fire within the materials, LAFD Heavy Equipment is responding to assist in moving the pile so the water can effectively reach all pockets of fire. One firefighter is being transported for non-life threatening injury sustained when a civilian vehicle ran over a 4" supply line which knocked the firefighter to the ground. Due to the location of the nearest fire hydrant to an incident, it is sometimes necessary (we avoid it whenever possible) to cross streets with the large diameter supply line. This serves as a reminder to NEVER cross over a fire department hose line. Fortunately this was a minor injury but the potential for life-altering injuries is very real. The 9-1-1 call was received at 4:49AM. Firefighter will remain on scene through the morning working for a knockdown and continuing with the needed overhaul. Commuters are advised to avoid Ventura Blvd between Tampa Ave and Shirley Ave - please seek one of the many alternate routes. No further details.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E293 E83 E84 E93 EM15 EM17 HE2 RA93 T73 T93; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0305; 09:34AM; 1825 Ocean Front Walk; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YHunwr; Venice; The business owner was in the building and heard a popping sound prior to the fire igniting. Cause of the fire is attributed to lithium-ion battery overheating. The pet dog of the business owner was sadly found deceased in the structure after fire extinguishment. Address updated from the initial alert (1 E 19th Av) No further details or updates anticipated. ; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0391; 08:52AM; 1831 E 111th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yyqlMs; Watts; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters extinguished the fire in 12 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was prevented from extending to any other structures. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 E21 E233 E264 E64 RA64 RA65 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 16; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0391; 08:40AM; 1831 E 111th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yyqlMs; Watts; One story, single family dwelling with heavy smoke showing. LA Co FD also has at least one engine on scene. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 E21 E233 E264 E64 RA64 RA65 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 16; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0385; 08:47AM; 510 S Kenmore Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JyVrK4; Koreatown; KNOCKDOWN: 30 firefighters extinguished the fire in 13 minutes with no injuries reported. Firefighters contained the fire to the unit of origin. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E211 E229 E29 E52 RA6 RA806 T11 T29; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0385; 08:34AM; 510 S Kenmore Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JyVrK4; Koreatown; Six story (pre-1933) apartment building with fire showing from one unit on the 3rd floor. One additional task forced requested. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E229 E29 RA6 RA806 T29; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0305; 07:41AM; 1 E 19th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YHunwr; Venice; KNOCKDOWN: 32 firefighters extinguished the fire in 35 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire extended (to what degree is being evaluated at this time) to the two adjacent businesses. LAFD resources will be on scene through the morning conducting overhaul operations. Due to the narrow streets and limited access, residents are requested to avoid the area while LAFD apparatus are still on scene. No further details.; FS 63; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 BC9 CM40 CM42 E263 E269 E62 E63 E67 RA63 T63 T69; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

title.a: Update Structure Fire Updated Address 03/12/2023 INC#0305

item.description: Update Updated Address Structure Fire; INC#0305; 07:20AM; 1825 Ocean Front Walk; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YHunwr; Venice; Structure type updated to a one story, row of commercial businesses (approx 50' x 50') with heavy fire in one unit (an electric scooter store hence large number of lithium-ion batteries). Additional resources requested and are reflected in this alert.; FS 63; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E263 E63 E67 RA63 T63; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Rubbish Fire; INC#0305; 07:06AM; 1 E 19th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YHunwr; Venice; One story, commercial building (initial reports of DBA a gym) with heavy fire showing through the roof. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 63; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; E63; CH7; Margaret Stewart

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 03/11/2023 INC#1767

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1767; 11:03PM; 826 S Santa Fe Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Fcy4DB; #DowntownLA; Firefighters forced entry into the metalclad building. After withdrawing to defensive operations and knocking back the flames, firefighters re-entered the building to finish the job. Ultimately, it took 96 firefighters 46 minutes to extinguish the flames. Thankfully, this particular metal-working business did not contain some of the flammable metals (like magnesium) that can be a concern, but only aluminum was the main metal found inside. There were no reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E17 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E221 E25 E27 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 HR3 RA17 RA209 RA25 SQ21 T10 T11 T2 T20 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange
